title: NSW cop charged with shoplifting in Berry to face court | Illawarra Mercury | Wollongong, NSW
text: A police officer accused of stealing has been told to face court for his alleged crime. The male officer allegedly [stole from a shop](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/story/8660346/illawarra-retailers-face-theft-crisis-amid-falling-home-break-ins/) on Queen Street at Berry on Sunday, July 7. "Following inquiries, today [Thursday, August 15], a 51-year-old constable attached to a specialist command was issued a court attendance notice for shoplifting value less than or equal to $2000," a [NSW Police](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/news/court-crime/) spokesperson said. "The officer's employment status is under review." He will appear at [Nowra Local Court](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/news/court-crime/) on Tuesday, September 24. The charges comes as the NSW Police force faces intense public scrutiny over a number of recent separate issues. Commissioner Karen Webb was [cleared of misconduct over bottles of gin](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/story/8722765/police-chief-cleared-of-misconduct-over-bottles-of-gin/), and separately two [police officers accused of assaulting an elderly man in Picton](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/story/8720904/cops-to-fight-allegations-of-assaulting-elderly-man/) on January 21, 2024, are fighting charges stemming from the incident. Meanwhile, former NSW police officer Beaumont Lamarre-Condon, who allegedly killed two men - including one he briefly dated - has this week formally been charged with their [domestic violence-related murders](https://www.illawarramercury.com.au/story/8728148/ex-cop-faces-court-on-double-dv-murder-charges/).
